title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:52 <abusenius> has quit  
02:17 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:51 <sdumitriu> has quit  
03:15 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki

04:47 <jamesxu> has quit  
05:06 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
07:33 <sburjan`> has quit  
07:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:55 <vmassol> has quit  
07:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <vmassol> has quit  
09:02 <alx> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <jamesxu> has quit  
10:00 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <alx> has quit  
11:05 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
11:23 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <@cjdelisle> http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/linux-security-4/lost-execute-rights-on-chmod-itself-491622/  
12:00 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
12:00 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: hi  
12:00 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
12:01 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: something strange happened the non index quries seem to work =-O  
12:01 <pulasthi> i mean without me doing anything  
12:02 <@cjdelisle> do you have a test to show?  
12:02 <pulasthi> SELECT FROM org.xwiki.store.datanucleus.test.Document WHERE content == "ContentA" && notIndexed == "Hello"  
12:02 <pulasthi> only returns one result  
12:02 <pulasthi> i just cloned it again from git and ran it  
12:02 <@cjdelisle> SELECT FROM org.xwiki.store.datanucleus.test.Document WHERE notIndexed == "Hello" <-- run that  
12:03 <pulasthi> that genarates a error  
12:03 <@cjdelisle> That's the only case that doesn't work  
12:04 <pulasthi> :-/  
12:04 <@cjdelisle> SELECT FROM org.xwiki.store.datanucleus.test.Document WHERE notIndexed ==  "Hello" && content == "ContentA"  
12:04 <pulasthi> i kind of rememberd that the first returned two results  
12:04 <@cjdelisle> ^^doublechech that one thogh  
12:04 <pulasthi> that also worlds  
12:04 <@cjdelisle> ok  
12:04 <pulasthi> works  
12:04 <@cjdelisle> so your project is easy  
12:05 <pulasthi> yeah kk my mistake  
12:05 <@cjdelisle> It only matters if every single constraint in the query is on a non-indexed field.  
12:05 <pulasthi> yeah  
12:05 <@cjdelisle> That's also why I'm not too worried about performance.  
12:05 <@cjdelisle> Because it's kind of an edge case.  
12:06 <@cjdelisle> But still people will be mad if they see null pointer exceptions  
12:06 <pulasthi> k ill put up the code in ah while im almost done  
12:06 <@cjdelisle> great  
12:06 <pulasthi> ill let u know when i do  
12:06 <pulasthi> :)  
13:33 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: hi i put the code in git hub  
14:22 <@cjdelisle> ok  
14:22 <pulasthi> https://github.com/pulasthi/Datanucleus-Cassandra-Plugin  
14:23 <pulasthi> im off for a bit. let me know if i have anything wrong :)  
14:24 <pulasthi> \*i have done  
14:24 <@cjdelisle> looking at the test... looks nice :)  
14:25 <pulasthi> i only changed one test  
14:25 <pulasthi> :)  
14:31 <@cjdelisle> I'll be right back, and start reviewing your code  
14:31 <@cjdelisle> https://github.com/cjdelisle/xwiki-store-datanucleus/blob/master/src/test/java/org/xwiki/store/datanucleus/test/AppTest.java#L160  
14:31 <@cjdelisle> there's a basic outline of what's needed in order to get from here to there.  
14:32 <@cjdelisle> XWQL is really similar to JPQL \*if we use a certain schema (which I am working on implementing)  
14:40 <@cjdelisle> pulasthi: are you using linux?  
14:44 <pulasthi> has quit  
14:56 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
15:06 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki  
15:35 <sburjan`> has quit  
15:48 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
15:49 <@cjdelisle> hi pulasthi did you see my line notes?  
15:49 <pulasthi> yeah just saw them i was away for bit  
15:49 <pulasthi> ill reply after going through them  
15:50 <@cjdelisle> ok, your code looks good, the code \*style\* is not up to XWiki standards (I was there once, it's nothing bad)  
15:50 <@cjdelisle> the problem is the code you're working on is not up to XWiki standards either.  
15:51 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: hmm ill work on that the main reason is i i wrote a java code after 4 months or so  
15:51 <@cjdelisle> What I think makes the most sense is for me to add our checkstyle to the build but only enforce it on the file which you added  
15:51 <pulasthi> im developing a javascript library at WSO2  
15:52 <@cjdelisle> js is a nice language  
15:52 <@cjdelisle> I found it to be a lot like C  
15:53 <pulasthi> i don't know C that well :)  
15:53 <@cjdelisle> it's like js  
15:53 <@cjdelisle> hehe  
15:53 <pulasthi> anyway how do i add the checklstyle  
15:53 <@cjdelisle> I can commit the addition of the checkstyle then you can pull that in.  
15:54 <@cjdelisle> we use 4 spaces per tab which is the biggest deviation from what Todd Nine is doing.  
15:55 <pulasthi> ahh i think i should go through the developer wiki again :)  
15:56 <@cjdelisle> that's why I wanted to get the checkstyle implemented, the best way to learn the rules to to break them and be corrected ;)  
15:59 <pulasthi> :)  
16:07 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Are you very busy?  
16:11 <@cjdelisle> somewhat why?  
16:11 <@cjdelisle> actually quite but still curious why  
16:12 <@sdumitriu> I was wondering why that ui test is failing  
16:12 <@sdumitriu> It always works locally  
16:12 <@cjdelisle> link?  
16:13 <@sdumitriu> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/100/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/CreatePageTest/testCreatePageWhenNoTemplateAvailable/  
16:28 <abusenius> has quit  
16:37 <@cjdelisle> pulasthi: https://github.com/cjdelisle/Datanucleus-Cassandra-Plugin/commit/131ac55b479c62d42c8ccb7e72b54be75284fe04  
16:38 <pulasthi> thanks  
16:43 <@cjdelisle> One other thing, it would be nice to have more descriptive commit messages.  
16:44 <pulasthi> ok :)  
16:55 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <sburjan`> has quit  
17:02 <@cjdelisle> any questions about the checkstyle rules, just ask  
17:02 <@cjdelisle> the @version tag should say:  
17:02 <@cjdelisle> @version $Id:$  
17:02 <@cjdelisle> err  
17:02 <@cjdelisle> @version $Id$  
17:03 <@cjdelisle> That way git will put the commit hash in  
17:03 <@cjdelisle> Go ahead and use 4 spaces and if Todd demands \t then we can convert it with sed later.  
19:04 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: found a bug in the code  
19:04 <pulasthi> it doest work properly for inheritance  
19:05 <pulasthi> i will start working on that  
19:05 <@cjdelisle> cool  
19:06 <@cjdelisle> I don't see inheritance being really important for us but what is important is having a patch which Todd will be happy to merge.  
19:08 <pulasthi>  the patch should be usable by other as well so its better if i fix it  
19:08 <@cjdelisle> yup  
20:11 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki  
20:39 <DrLou> has quit  
22:16 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
23:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki
